overview: Mathew is the lead programmer for the Sookboxâ€™s iOS application suite. Prior to Sookbox, he worked with a charitable organization in Cambridge to create an iOS application and has done research developing the Rip Van Winkle Cipher for use in network security. He has also worked with Alan Guth, the person who put the bang in the big bang, developing models of how quantum fluctuations at 10^-37 seconds appear in the structure of the universe today. Also, he has lead a team to develop a facebook integrated location-sharing app, Bump Into Me. Mathew is currently a student at MIT, majoring in both physics and computer science and electrical engineering, and is planning a sabbatical to work full time for Sookbox.
